actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the earned income credit where the taxpayer's child regularly attends school.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase by five percent the amount of the earned income tax credit for each child of the taxpayer between the ages of six and 18 certified as having attended an accredited school for at least 95 percent of the school year. Amends part A (Aid to Families with Dependent Children (AFDC)) of title IV of the Social Security Act to authorize a State to increase by five percent the amount of AFDC assistance provided with respect to a child meeting these same school attendance requirements.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the earned income credit where the taxpayer's child regularly attends school.
